txt.en: 'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'
The Word of a Healer

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'You will help us repel the coming Dourhand attack, [placeholder]? Very good! We can always use another Rune-keeper!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you the more beneficial runes of healing. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'
The Rune-keeper Huldar is at Othrikar, in the North Downs.\n\nYou have been told that the dwarf Huldar may be able to teach you about beneficial runes of healing.

'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you the more beneficial runes of healing. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'
Huldar is at Othrikar, in the North Downs.\n\nThe dwarf Huldar has agreed to teach you what he knows about runes of healing if you help repel an attack by the Dourhands.

'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you the more beneficial runes of healing. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'
Huldar is at Othrikar, in the North Downs.\n\nYou were of great assistance to the dwarves of Othrikar during the Dourhand attack and should speak now to Huldar as was agreed.

'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you the more beneficial runes of healing. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

Talk to Huldar and assist in the defence of Othrikar

'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you the more beneficial runes of healing. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'
Talk to Huldar at Othrikar
'The word of a healer is something to which the Wise pay great attention!'
'Hail, Rune-keeper! I thank you again for your aid.'

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'

'You were told I can tell you more about runes of healing? You weren't told wrong, [placeholder], but I'm afraid I do not have the time to spare at the moment. Rumour has reached us that the Dourhands may be planning another attack!

'If you help us during their attack, I will tell you what I know of healing runes at your leisure.

'Let me know if this agreement suits you.'

'I am quite embarrassed, [placeholder], that I should be wounded so during the attack and require your aid in such fashion. Still, I am pleased you were there, as are the other dwarves of Othrikar!\n\n'I will teach you what I know of the healing runes, [placeholder]. If your performance during the Dourhand attack is anything to go by, you are sure to use them effectively!'

'You were told I can tell you more about runes of healing? You weren't told wrong, [placeholder], but I'm afraid I do not have the time to spare at the moment. Rumour has reached us that the Dourhands may be planning another attack!

'If you help us during their attack, I will tell you what I know of healing runes at your leisure.

'Let me know if this agreement suits you.'

'I am quite embarrassed, [placeholder], that I should be wounded so during the attack and require your aid in such fashion. Still, I am pleased you were there, as are the other dwarves of Othrikar!\n\n'I will teach you what I know of the healing runes, [placeholder]. If your performance during the Dourhand attack is anything to go by, you are sure to use them effectively!'
Rune-keepers are masters of the written word, and the words of healing captured in runic form are especially powerful and useful in a dangerous world.

'There is still much you do not understand, [placeholder], though you are a Rune-keeper of considerable ability. Runes of healing can be put to even greater uses than you know; however, you need a teacher to instruct you in these uses.\n\n'The dwarf Huldar is a Rune-keeper of especial skill, and he may be able to teach you of these uses. Seek him out at Othrikar, in the North Downs. If he is impressed by your grasp of the mysteries, he may prove an able teacher.'
